Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2020 IEEE/IFIP Network Operations and Management Symposium (NOMS'2020)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)/International Federation for Information Processing (IFIP) Network Operations and Management Symposium (NOMS) is a leading conference in network and service management. NOMS 2020 will be held in April 20-24, 2020 in Budapest, Hungary. Attending the NOMS conference will expose students to frontier research topics in the area of network and service management and to be inspired by researches from around the world working in these fields. Students may also utilize this opportunity to establish collaboration relationships with other researchers who share similar interests during the conference social and academic activities. <br/><br/>This project provides travel support for students in the United States to attend the NOMS 2020 conference. The travel awards will focus on bringing in first-time attendees and under-represented minority students into the conference, since attending conferences is an important part of their educational experience, and they often have limited travel funds. The research community and the technical workforce benefit from the improvement of students in the pipeline, and new ideas generated through introducing new participants into the research field.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
NOMS 2020 NSF Student Travel Grant Spending Report


Introduction

The PI (Carol Fung) received an NSF grant of amount $15,000 (Award #2014439) in 2020 tosupport US students to travel to attend the 2020 IEEE/IFIP Network Operations and Management Symposium (NOMS'2020). Due to the COVID pandemic the conference went virtual and no travel grant was spent. The grant was further extended to support students to attend 2021 IEEE/IFIP InternationalSymposium on Integrated Networks (IM 2021).

With this grant we were able to support 6 USstudents with their travel expense to attend IM 2021. The conference was held virtually and there were over 300 registered conference participants from all over the world to discuss frontier research topics in the field ofnetwork and service management. In this report we willprovide details on our award selection process, awardees information and follow-up information. Advertisement of the NSF grant opportunity

From January 2021 to February 2021, the PI launched a campaign to advertise the grantopportunity through multiple channels, including sending emails to all paper authors and TPCmembers, sending emails to a list of US university professors known working in the related area.To reach out to under-represented groups, the PI also emailed to the following groups and askedtheir correspondents to inform their society members about this grant opportunity:1. National Society of Black Engineers2. Computing Alliance for Hispanic Serving Institutions (CAHSI)3. Institute for Mentorship for African Americans in Computer Science (IAAMCS)4. Computing Research Association Committee on the Status ofWomen in Computing Research(CRAW)5. The Association for Women in Computing (AWC)6. Black Women in Computing organization

Process on awardees selection

The IM STG committee closed the online application at the end of February and received over 20 student travel grant applications in total. Among them we selected 8 US students to be the NSF STG grant recipients. Two recipients ended up not submitting their receipts for reimbursement. We used the process described in the proposal, that is to group theapplications based on their categories and then select recipients based on several criteria,including: strength of research, academic excellence and financial need. To ensure the diversityof recipients we selected four female awardees. We notified the awardees by email and askedthem to confirm their acceptance of the grant. Participation of grant recipientThe PI informed the grant recipients that adequate participation of the conference is required tobe qualified for the travel reimbursement. The PI followed up the grant recipients during the conference and made sure they had conference attending activities. They were alsoasked to attend the closing ceremony online on Thursday. All NSF award recipients satisfied the mandatory conference participation requirement.

Reimbursment

After the conference, the PI emailed the STG recipients and asked them to email their conference registration receipt for reimbursment. The PI cooridinated with all STG recipients with their reimbursement requests. Two STG recipients ended up not finishing their reimbursement process since they did not send their W9 form.
